Player History
Had first career hit on 5/18/1965, off Don McMahon (LAN)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/4/1965, off Bob Friend (PIT)...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1966...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1967...
Was selected to the 1969 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/2/1969 with a Torn Abdominal Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1969...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1969...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1970...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/20/1972 with a Tight Elbow, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 6/28/1973 with a Pulled Bicep Muscle, out for 7 weeks...
Injured on 5/31/1975 with a Inflamed Thigh Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Was selected to the 1976 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Pittsburgh on 10/3/1976...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1976...
Traded from New York (N) to Minnesota on 1/31/1977 (Going to NYM: SS R. Yount, P D. Warthen. Going to MIN: 2B R. Smith, SS R. Carew)...
Had 2000th career hit on 7/8/1977, off Dean Chance (CAL)...
